author: Ruman Ganguly
title: Raj Chakraborty to direct Suruchi Sangha's theme song -
text:
Suruchi Sangha, the New Alipore Puja, which has Trinamool minister Arup Biswas as its president, is ready to unveil a theme song that has been penned by chief minister Mamata Banerjee.
Shreya Ghoshal will sing the number that has music by Jeet Gannguli. The music video, to be shot by director Raj Chakrabarty , may feature actresses like Raima Sen, Nusrat Jahan, Mimi Chakraborty and Srabanti. The build-up to the Suruchi Sangha Puja started with a teaser campaign -'Raima or ma ke bole mummy , Nusrat or ma ke bole ammi, Ami ma boli'. The lines, which were on hoardings all over Kolkata, had actually been penned by Arup Biswas, who has earlier worked in an ad agency ."After the teaser came out, our Quote: : "Ma go tumi sarbojonin jar neiko tulona, Ma-mother-ammi eki bhasa ta kokhono bhulona'. This too became hugely popular," said Arup.
Everyone from Arijit Singh to Shaan and Sonu Nigam has lend their voice to the theme song of Suruchi Sangha in the past. "From Mahalaya, the song will be available as a callertune on nine mobile networks. It will be uploaded on YouTube too. From Panchami to Dashami, this video will be aired all day on LCD screens at the pandal. The theme for this year's puja is our universal mother," added Arup.
The lyrics written by the CM go like this: "Ma go tumi sarbo jonin, achho hridoy jure, Ma ammi mother aki ta bhuli ki kore, Ghore je ma mondireteo dekhi mora sei mayeri mukh, Ma debi te farak kothay sob ma-i je aki debir rup, Tri bhuboneo achho ma go achho matir ghore, Ma ammi moth er aki bhuli ta ki kore, Ma go nin achho hridoy jure." tumi sorbojonin achho hridoy jure."
Raj Chakrabarty , who is busy with the promotions of his Puja release, Katmundu , said, "I will be shooting on October 1 and 2 in a bonedi bari. Ma Durga is present in each girl and we will try to capture that. I plan to take Raima, Nusrat, Mimi and Srabanti, depending on their availability."
Jeet, who has been composing the theme music for the past four years for Suruchi Sangha, said, "Didi has written such beautiful lines that my music only has to complement it. There is a festive feel to the song."
